meanings.definition: A condition or circumstance that puts one in a favorable or superior position.
meanings.sent1: Having an advantage in the game helped me win easily.
meanings.sent2: She used her advantage of being taller to reach the top shelf.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it had an advantage over the mouse, but the mouse outsmarted it.
meanings.sent4: In the race of life, having an advantage is like starting with a head start.
meanings.sent5: The advantage of having a map is knowing where to go.

meanings.definition: A benefit gained from a situation.
meanings.sent1: Eating fruits and vegetables has the advantage of keeping you healthy.
meanings.sent2: One advantage of living near the park is being able to go for a walk easily.
meanings.sent3: The advantage of having a big family is always having someone to talk to.
meanings.sent4: The advantage of a good night's sleep is feeling refreshed in the morning.
meanings.sent5: The advantage of reading is gaining knowledge and new perspectives.

meanings.definition: To benefit or gain an advantage over someone or something.
meanings.sent1: I tried to advantage myself by studying hard for the test.
meanings.sent2: She wanted to advantage her team by scoring the winning goal.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox tried to advantage the rabbit in their game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: He always looks for ways to advantage himself in any situation.
meanings.sent5: The student tried to advantage from the extra credit opportunity.
